meanings.meaning: 1. to fall; to drop; to come down; to crash; to collapse; to cave in; to give way おじいちゃんが階段から落ちて大怪我をしたんだ。Grandpa fell down the stairs and got a serious injury.
2. to set (of the sun or moon); to sink; to dip; to go down 山の向こうに日が落ちた。The sun descended behind the mountains.
3. to decrease (of popularity, quality, speed, sales, etc.); to fall; to drop; to go down; to decline; to deteriorate; to abate (of wind) 今月は売上が落ちた。Sales are down this month.
4. to be inferior (to); to be not as good (as); to fall short (of)

5. to come off (of dirt, paint, makeup, etc.); to come out (of a stain); to fade (of colour); to be removed (of an illness, possessing spirit, etc.) このインキの染みは洗っても落ちない。This ink stain will not wash out.
6. to disappear (of excess fat); to become thinner; to become leaner
7. to be left out; to be omitted; to be missing 私の名前が名簿から落ちています。My name is omitted from the list.
8. to fail (an exam); to lose (a contest, election, etc.); to be unsuccessful 勉強しないと試験に落ちるよ。If you don't study, you will fail the exam.
9. to decline (of morals, character, etc.); to become vulgar (e.g. of a conversation); to stoop (to); to sink (so low) also written as 堕ちる僕に嘘をつくとは彼も落ちたもんだ。He degraded himself by telling me lies.
10. to be ruined; to go under; to fall (into hell) also written as 堕ちるお前の魂は地獄に墜ちるのだ。Your soul has been condemned to hell.
11. to fall (in love, asleep, etc.) See also 恋に落ちる, See also 眠りに落ちる彼女は彼を一目見て恋に落ちた。She fell in love with him at first sight.
12. to fall (into someone's hands); to be accepted (of a bid); to be won (of a tender); to be honoured (of a bill) その都市は敵の手に落ちた。The city fell to the enemy.
13. to fall into (a trap); to fall for (a trick)
14. to give in
15. to confess; to own up
16. to come to (a conclusion, topic, etc.); to arrive at (in the end)
17. to leave (a city, castle, etc.); to (be defeated and) flee
18. to sink in; to be accepted (in one's heart) See also 腑に落ちない, See also 胸に落ちる
19. to fall (to the enemy); to be defeated
20. to come in (of money)
21. to fall (upon; of light, a shadow, one's gaze, etc.)
22. to pass out (in judo); to fall unconscious
23. to go down (of a website, server, etc.); to crash Computingサーバーが落ちていた。The server was down.
24. to log out (of an online game, chat room, etc.); to drop out; to leave; to go offline Slang
25. to move to deeper water (of a fish in cold weather)
26. to die (of an animal)
墜ちる 【おちる】、落る 【おちる】
落る: Irregular okurigana usage.

sentences.translation: Grandpa fell down the stairs and got a serious injury.
The sun descended behind the mountains.
This ink stain will not wash out.
My name is omitted from the list.
If you don't study, you will fail the exam.
He degraded himself by telling me lies.
Your soul has been condemned to hell.
She fell in love with him at first sight.
The city fell to the enemy.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to drop; to lose; to let fall; to shed (light); to cast (one's gaze); to pour in (liquid); to leave behind 彼は花瓶を落とした。He dropped a vase.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to clean off (dirt, makeup, paint, etc.); to remove (e.g. stains or facial hair); to lose; to spend money at a certain place; to omit; to leave out; to secretly let escape トニーはシャツを脱いで、それでピアノのよごれを落としました。Tony took off his shirt and cleaned the piano with it.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 3. to lose (a match); to reject (an applicant); to fail (a course); to defeat (in an election) 昨年彼は期末の２科目を落とした。Last year, he failed two of his final examinations.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 4. to lower (e.g. shoulders or voice); to lessen (e.g. production or body weight); to worsen (quality); to reduce (e.g. rank or popularity); to speak badly of; to make light of; to fall into straitened circumstances ほっそい道にほとんどスピードを落とさず、走りこんだ。「近道なんですよ」「ってここ、あぜ道～～～っ！」We sped into the narrow track, hardly dropping any speed. "It's a short cut!" "Oi! It's a footpath!!"

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 5. to fall into (e.g. a dilemma or sin); to make one's own; to have one's bid accepted; to force surrender; to take (e.g. an enemy camp or castle); to forcefully convince; to press for a confession; to deal with

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 6. to download; to copy from a computer to another medium Computing日本語のソフトを落とすコツ・いいサイトありませんか？Are there any knacks, or good sites, for downloading Japanese software?

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 7. to make someone swoon (judo) Martial arts

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 8. to finish a story (e.g. with the punch line)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 9. to finish (a period, e.g. of fasting)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 10. to win over; to seduce; to conquer (unwillingness) Colloquial
落す 【おとす】

meanings.meaning: 1. depravity; corruption; degradation

1. force of habit 高校時代からつきあっている彼氏はいるものの、つきあいが惰性になっていると感じ、不満をつのらせている。She has a boyfriend she's been going out with since high school but feels their relationship has become a matter of habit and is increasingly dissatisfied.
2. inertia Physics, Rare term, See also 慣性
